text: Consider the following function definition. Tt foo (it 1) { <) return 1; } else if (n < 0) { return 0; } int total = 0; for(intm=1;m<n;m+=1){ int left = foo (m / 2); int right = foo (nâ€” 1 -m/2); total + = left * right; } return total; } Of the following choices, which two optimizations would be most effective for this code? (@) Constant propagation and dead code elimination. (b) Dead code elimination and common sub-expression elimination (c) Copy propagation and constant propagation. (d) Code motion and common sub-expression elimination.
